derivation.yuyuan_name: late 16th cent. (in the sense 'the fact of being an efficient cause'): from Latin efficientia, from efficere 'accomplish' (see effect)

entry.def: Efficiency is the quality of being able to do a task successfully, without wasting time or energy.

example.ex: There are many ways to increase agricultural efficiency in the poorer areas of the world.
example.tran: 有很多方法能够提高世界贫困地区的农业效率。

entry.tran: （物理学、工程学中的）效率，功率
entry.def: In physics and engineering, efficiency is the ratio between the amount of energy a machine needs to make it work, and the amount it produces.

means.word_mean: 1. the ratio of the output to the input of any system
2. skillfulness in avoiding wasted time and effort;

sentences.sentence: "she did the work with great efficiency"

auth_sentence.content: Workers are remunerated in strict proportion to their efficiency.

stems_affixes.type_exp: 表名词,ence的变体,"性质,状态"

stems_affixes.word_buile: com全部+plac平静+ency性质,状态→身心平静→自满
de去掉+fici做+ency性质,状态→做得不够→缺点,缺陷
ef出+fici做+ency性质,状态→能做出事来→效率
persist坚持+ency性质,状态→n.固执,持续
solv溶解+ency性质,状态→n.溶解力,还债能力

紧急情况,突然事件,非常时刻
stems_affixes.word_buile: emerge浮现+ency性质,状态→emergency→突然出现的事情

Sentence.sentence: As baby boomers(二战后婴儿潮时期出生的人) came of high-school age, big schools promised economic efficiency.
Suburban high schools were established in the hope of increasing economic efficiency.
The goal increase people's work efficiency.

jushi.english: Friction lowers the efficiency of a machine.
